00039 template <class T>
00040 class Array : public Iterable<T> {
00041     #ifndef SYLPH_DOXYGEN
00042     friend class Array<String>;
00043     #endif
00044 private:
00045 
00046     class ArrayIterator : public Iterator {
00047     public:
00048         ArrayIterator(Array<T> & array) : ar(&array), idx(0), last(0) {
00049         }
00050 
00051         #ifndef SYLPH_DOXYGEN
00052         virtual ~ArrayIterator() {}
00053         #endif
00054 
00055         bool hasNext() const {
00056             return idx < ar->length;
00057         }
00058 
00059         const T & next() const {
00060             return last = *ar[idx++];
00061         }
00062 
00063         bool hasPrevious() const {
00064             return idx > 0;
00065         }
00066 
00067         const T & previous() const {
00068             return last = *ar[--idx];
00069         }
00070 
00071         std::idx_t nextIndex() const {
00072             return idx;
00073         }
00074 
00075         std::idx_t previousIndex() const {
00076             return idx - 1;
00077         }
00078 
00079         virtual void front() const {
00080             idx = 0;
00081         }
00082 
00083         virtual void back() const {
00084             idx = ar->length;
00085         }
00086 
00087         void set(T & t) {
00088             *last = t;
00089         }
00090         void insert(T & t);
00091         void remove();
00092     protected:
00093 #ifndef SYLPH_DOXYGEN
00094         Array<T> * ar;
00095         mutable T * last;
00096         mutable std::idx_t idx;
00097 #endif
00098     };
00099 
00100 public:
00106     const int & length;
00107 public:
00116     inline static Array<T> fromPointer(std::size_t length, T * orig) {
00117         Array<T> ar(length);
00118         for (int x = 0; x < length; x++)ar[x] = orig[x];
00119         return ar;
00120     }
00121 public:
00122 
00130     explicit Array(std::size_t len) : _length(len), length(_length) {
00131         data = new Data(len);
00132         data->_carray = (T*) calloc(len, sizeof (T));
00133     }
00134 
00141     Array(const std::initializer_list<T> & il) : _length(il.size()), length(_length) {
00142         data = new Data(_length);
00143         data->_carray = (T*) calloc(il.size(), sizeof (T));
00144         carraycopy(il.begin(), 0, data->_carray, 0, il.size());
00145     }
00146 
00154     Array(const T array[]) : _length(carraysize(array)), length(_length) {
00155         data = new Data(_length);
00156         data->_carray = (T*) calloc(_length, sizeof (T));
00157         carraycopy(array, 0, data->_carray, 0, _length);
00158     }
00159 
00165     Array(const Array<T> & other) : _length(other._length) {
00166         if (this == &other) return;
00167         this->data = other.data;
00168         this->_length = other.data->length;
00169         data->refcount++;
00170     }
00182     Array(const basic_range<T> & ran) : _length(ran.last() - ran.first()),
00183             length(_length) {
00184         data = new Data(_length);
00185         data->_carray = (T*) calloc(_length, sizeof (T));
00186         idx_t idx = 0;
00187         for (T x = ran.first(); x < ran.last(); x++) {
00188             *this[idx] = x; idx++;
00189         }
00190     }
00191 
00196     virtual ~Array() {
00197         data->refcount--;
00198         if (!data->refcount) delete data;
00199     }
00200 
00205     Iterator iterator() const {
00206         return ArrayIterator<T > (*this);
00207     }
00208 
00215     MutableIterator mutableIterator() {
00216         return ArrayIterator<T > (*this);
00217     }
00218 
00224     T * carray() {
00225         return data->_carray;
00226     }
00227 
00234     const T *carray() const {
00235         return data->_carray;
00236     }
00237 
00246     Array<T> & operator=(const Array<T> & other) {
00247         if (this->data == other.data) return;
00248         this->data->refcount--;
00249         if (!this->data->refcount) delete this->data;
00250         this->data = other.data;
00251         this->_length = other.data->length;
00252         data->refcount++;
00253         return *this;
00254     }
00255 
00263     T & operator[](std::sidx_t idx) throw (Exception) {
00264         if (abs(idx) < length) {
00265             return idx > 0 ? data->_carray[idx] : data->_carray(length + idx);
00266         } else {
00267             sthrow(ArrayException, "Array overflow");
00268         }
00269     }
00270 
00278     const T & operator[](std::sidx_t idx) const throw (Exception) {
00279         if (abs(idx) < length) {
00280             return idx > 0 ? data->_carray[idx] : data->_carray(length + idx);
00281         } else {
00282             sthrow(ArrayException, "Array overflow");
00283         }
00284     }
00285 
00294     Array<T> operator[](const range & ran) throw (Exception) {
00295         if (ran.first() < 0 || ran.last() > length)
00296             sthrow(ArrayException, "Array overflow");
00297 
00298         Array<T> toReturn = Array<T>::fromPointer(ran.last() - ran.first(),
00299                 data->_carray + ran.first());
00300         return toReturn;
00301     }
00302 
00308     const Array<T> operator[](const range & ran) const throw (Exception) {
00309         if (ran.first() < 0 || ran.last() > length)
00310             sthrow(ArrayException, "Array overflow");
00311 
00312         Array<T> toReturn = Array<T>::fromPointer(ran.last() - ran.first(),
00313                 data->_carray + ran.first());
00314         return toReturn;
00315     }
00316 
00317 #ifndef SYLPH_DOXYGEN
00318 private:
00319 
00320     struct Data {
00321         explicit Data(size_t length) : Data::_length(length), refcount(1) {
00322 
00323         }
00324 
00325         virtual ~Data() {
00326             free(_carray);
00327         }
00328         const int _length;
00329         T * _carray;
00330         suint refcount;
00331     } * data;
00332     private int _length;
00333 #endif
00334 };

00338 template<>
00339 class Array<String> : public Array<String> {
00340 public:
00341 
00342     static inline Array<String> fromPointer(std::size_t length, char ** orig) {
00343         Array<String> ar(length);
00344         for (int x = 0; x < length; x++)ar[x] = orig[x];
00345         return ar;
00346     }

00349 
00357 template<class T>
00358 inline bool operator==(const Array<T>& lhs, const Array<T>& rhs) {
00359     return lhs.length == rhs.length ?
00360             std::equal(lhs.carray[0], lhs.carray[lhs.length - 1], rhs[0]) : false;
00361 }
00362 
00370 template<class T>
00371 inline bool operator<(const Array<T>& lhs, const Array<T>& rhs) {
00372     return lhs.length == rhs.length ?
00373             std::lexicographical_compare(lhs.carray[0], lhs.carray[lhs.length - 1],
00374             rhs[0], rhs[rhs.length - 1]) : false;
00375 }
